stimulusHtml:
Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.)

The work shown is Travelers among Mountains and Streams, created by Fan Kuan, circa 1000 C.E. In the work, Fan Kuan conveyed his ideas about the natural world and the relationship between humans and nature.

Select and identify another work that conveys ideas about the natural world and the relationship between humans and nature. You may select a work from the list below or any other relevant work about nature or created in nature from South, East, and Southeast Asia (300 B.C.E.–1980 C.E.).

Describe the specific content of both Travelers among Mountains and Streams and your selected work.

Using specific visual evidence from both works, explain at least two similarities and/or differences in how the two works represent the natural world.

Explain at least one similarity or difference in how both works convey ideas about the relationship between humans and nature within their respective cultures. Use specific evidence about both Travelers among Mountains and Streams and your selected work in your explanation.

When identifying the work you select, you should try to include all of the following identifiers: title or designation, name of the artist and/or culture of origin, date of creation, and materials. You will earn credit for the identification if you provide at least two accurate identifiers, but you will not be penalized if any additional identifiers you provide are inaccurate. If you select a work from the list below, you must include at least two accurate identifiers beyond those that are given.

Ryoan-ji Under the Wave off Kanagawa
